app.short: A short and small helper for Toyota Kata practitioners

message: This page will contain the badges you earned while using the app.
This functionality is still under development.
Here you can see a (partially working) mockup example of what it might become.
Clicking on an earned badge, you can read its description.
badges.title: Badges

4steps.title: The Four Steps of the Improvement Kata

back.caption: Have the learner state the <bold>obstacle</bold> being worked on
back.q1: 1. What did you plan as your <bold>Last Step</bold>?
back.quote: Because you don't actually know what the result of a step will be!
back.title: Reflect on the Last Step

front.caption: *You'll often work on the same obstacle with several experiments
front.q3.1: 3. What <bold>Obstacles</bold> do you think are preventing you from reaching the target condition?
front.q5: 5. How quickly can we go and see what we <bold>Have Learned</bold> from taking that step?
front.title: The Five Questions

carnegie.p1: A pedestrian on 57th Street sees a musician getting out of a cab and asks, “How do you get to Carnegie Hall?”.
carnegie.p2: Without pause, the artist replies wearily, “Practice.”.
carnegie.title: Carnegie Hall

kts.text: Applying the pattern of the Improvement Kata (from the book 'Toyota Kata') to a persistently aggravating problem that involves obstacles and has no obvious solution. Statement used when someone has been repeatedly frustrated, wants black-and-white answers or expects someone else to solve the problem.
kts.title: Kata that Shit

read.explain: Read a document inside the app
read.title: Read

download.explain: Download the reference document from the Internet (with your browser!)
download.title: Download

pattern.p1: 1. What are we trying to achieve?
pattern.p4: 4. What's our next experiment, and what do we expect?
pattern.p5: 5. When can we see what we’ve learned from that step?
pattern.subtitle: The root of the five basic question card is this basic pattern
pattern.title: Five Coaching Questions

practice.1: Improvement Kata / Coaching Kata practitioners are creating a dynamic that helps humans everywhere practice more scientific ways of thinking and acting, toward the best we can imagine, and beyond.
practice.2: The 21st Century is demanding a way of working that is cognitively complex, interpersonal, iterative, and even entrepreneurial. Practicing the Improvement Kata and Coaching Kata is a way to obtain those skills and mindset, helping us adapt to the world around us. It doesn't give you solutions, but a thought process for how to approach your goals and obstacles.
practice.3: The Kata community has structured practice routines, called 'Starter Kata', for learning fundamentals for both the learner and the coach—like playing musical scales when learning a new instrument. Practicing Starter Kata is a foundation upon which any learner's creativity and initiative can grow.
practice.4: The practice routines of the Improvement Kata and Coaching Kata are a useful starting point for any team or organization that wants to develop and utilize a more scientific approach. Beginners start by trying to follow the pattern of the Starter Kata exactly. As their proficiency increases and they understand the purpose behind the routines, they can start to develop their own style, as long as it continues to incorporate the underlying scientific pattern and purpose.
practice.5: The 'Kata Code' defines what we think should probably not change as you advance and evolve your own style.
practice.title: Changing thinking through practice

docs.subtitle: To be read here or downloaded from the web!
docs.title: Read The Docs

tkc.3: * Understand the direction, grasp the current condition, establish a target condition, experiment toward the target condition.
tkc.5: * Have a coach, be a coach.
tkc.title: The Kata Code

feedback.after: You can also visit app pages listed in $t(nav.menu.about).
feedback.before: Welcome to TKCompanionApp, and thank you for being here.
messages: This app has neither Internet connection nor tracking tools, so I cannot know if you like it or not, or how you (want to) use it.
Please, feel free to reach out to me through the contact channels below, for any feedback.
feedback.title: Let's get in touch!

browse.explain: Browse an external Internet page (with your browser!)
browse.title: Browse

pdsa.q2: What is the Actual Condition now?
pdsa.q3: What Obstacles do you think are preventing you from reaching the target condition? Which *one* are you addressing now?
pdsa.q4: What is your Next Step? (Next experiment) What do you expect?
pdsa.q5: How quickly can we go and see what we Have Learned from taking that step?
pdsa.title: Plan-Do-Study-Act

wip.after: Feedbacks and ideas are very welcome.
wip.before: Thanks for clicking, but no actual action here, yet.
wip.title: Work in progress…
